item.title: Mark Wayne Glasmire: I LIke YOU! :-)
item.description: Finding the things you like to be around is easy when you take the time to take inventory of the things you care about. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington talks to songwriter and musician extraordinaire Mark Wayne Glasmire about the things he likes, as well as his new song, I Like You.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington
item.itunes:subtitle: Finding the things you like to be around is easy. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington talks to songwriter and musician extraordinaire Mark Wayne Glasmire about the things he likes, as well as his new song, I Like You.
item.itunes:summary: Finding the things you like to be around is easy when you take the time to take inventory of the things and people you care about. Mark Wayne Glasmire lets simple inspiration like that give rise to some great music. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington talks to songwriter and musician extraordinaire Mark Wayne Glasmire about the things he likes, as well as his new song, I Like You.

item.title: Lee Greenwood: Does God Still Bless The U.S.A.?
item.description: Of all the modern songs expressing the love most Americans feel for their country, none stands out better than Lee Greenwood's God Bless The U.S.A.. With everything that's happened now you might begin to wonder if that feeling still holds true. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington speaks to Lee Greenwood about his new book, "Does God Still Bless The U.S.A." and finds out Lee's hopes are for America.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: Country icon Lee Greenwood is one of America's country music icons. He's written a new book & in this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington speaks to Lee about , "Does God Still Bless The U.S.A." and finds out Lee's hopes are for America.

item.title: Marlee Scott: Life, Country & The Whole Train Wreck…;-)
item.description: Country music makes you feel something each time you hear a song. Whether it's that parting kiss from your first true love or that dismissive drunken departure of the woman you thought you knew. Marlee Scott knows these feelings all too well. In fact, in this CyberCountry Minute she's going to tell us more about her career and the train wrecks that turn into some pretty great songs.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.

item.title: Deborah Allen, Memphis & Amazing Graceland...
item.description: Anyone who has ever heard Deborah Allen sing can't help but get images of the soulful energy of rockabilly, Memphis and Elvis. Her new music will bring these high definition musical images to life. She tells Lance Yelvington more about her music and her newest, Amazing Graceland, in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Jett Williams: The Tradition Continues…
item.description: Her determination and her connection to the legend continue to push this talented country artist forward. Jett Williams has a story that is both tragic and joyful, just like a country song. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington finds out how Jett Williams is hitting all the right notes now with her successful career.

item.title: Mark Wayne Glasmire: Going Home
item.description: There's nothing like the feeling of seeing the sight of home after a long journey. Mark Wayne Glasmire knows a thing or two about the learning experience that is the different paths we walk through life. In this CyberCountry Minute, Lance Yelvington finds out about life, learning, love and Mark's new song, "Going Home".

item.title: The Oak Ridge Boys: It's Only Natural
item.description: The Oak Ridge Boys are one of those country groups that always makes you smile with the memories you attach to their songs. What's more, when it comes to their fans the Oaks like it when they that way. In this CyberCountry Minute the Oak Ridge Boys tell Lance about being new members of the Grand Ole Opry and their new music release, "It's Only Natural".

item.title: Jason Michael Carroll: It's All In The Numbers…
item.description: Jason Michael Carroll is one of those people who always has it together no matter where he is. A lot of that comes from his background and learned ability to roll with the punches. In this CyberCountry Minute Jason tells Lance about his new Cracker Barrel CD release, NUMBERS, and why keeping focused on what's important is the only way to go for life & music.

item.title: Mayberry & The Grascals: Bluegrass Inspiration Meets An American Classic
item.description: Have you ever wondered if one of America's classic television series had a great bluegrass soundtrack what it might sound like? Beyond that, who would record this instant musical classic? Wonder no more because the Grascals have a new CD release inspired by the Andy Griffith Show's Fiftieth Anniversary called, "Dance 'Til Your Stockings Are Hot and Ravelin". Lance Yelvington talks backstage at the Opry with Terry Eldredge and Terry Smith of the Grascals in this CyberCountry Minute about reruns, great music and Mayberry.

item.title: Rachel Holder: The Sweet Taste Of Chocolate, Music & Success
item.description: She's a very talented artist who has years of talent behind her, as well as a voice for which many musicians would give everything they have, and then some! Country artist Rachel Holder already has fans eating up her online hit, "Chocolate". In this CyberCountry Minute she tells Lance Yelvington what got her into music, why her fans everything, and what keeps her coming back for more.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.

item.title: The Grascals: Getting Together With Their Friends...
item.description: The Grascals have come a long way since they began their career singing with Dolly Parton. Because of their fantastic sound & great attitude they have made a lot of friends along the way. In this CyberCountry Minute, Danny Roberts and Jamie Johnson of the Grascals tell Lance Yelvington about their new Cracker Barrel Country Stores CD, Grascals & Friends, and a couple of the causes in which they believe.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this CyberCountry Minute, Danny Roberts and Jamie Johnson of the Grascals tell Lance Yelvington about their new Cracker Barrel Country Stores CD, Grascals & Friends, bluegrass tradition and causes they support like St. Jude's Children's Hospital.

item.title: The Roys: The Lonesome Whistle Of Bluegrass Tradition…
item.description: Bluegrass is a genre of music that holds tightly to its roots. While that might not sound like it would have much room for anything new in the way of music when you listen to new music like the CD, "Lonesome Whistle", from the Roys you would see that assumption would be completely and positively wrong. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington talks to Elaine and Lee Roy about their new CD, bluegrass and the things that keeps them sounding great.

item.title: HERRICK: Nonstop Rockin' Country!
item.description: The one thing you will see every time you witness this current incarnation of the group HERRICK take the stage is a full blown exposition of musical energy. Thinking in terms of doing anything halfway with their music is something Donna & Kerry Herrick don't know how to do. We hope they never figure that out, either. Lance Yelvington tells us more in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Kendall Phillips: The Path To Perfection & The Ryman...
item.description: Have you ever seen a performer that can get you out of your seat one moment, then make you cry the next? If you have chances are that performer might have been Kendall Phillips. This dynamic Indiana country girl describes herself as a cross between Dolly Parton, Keith Urban and Carrie Underwood. While that sound like an interesting combination, in this CyberCountry Minute Kendall tells Lance Yelvington why this melodious mashup has brought her great success and to the Mother Church of Country Music.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this CyberCountry Minute Indiana country girl Kendall Phillips tells Lance Yelvington why this melodious mashup of her experiences brings her great success, great fans and to the Mother Church of Country Music, the Ryman Auditorium.

item.title: Greg Scudder: Rockin' Country At The Ryman
item.description: Every one of us builds something. For Greg Scudder this could have meant staying in the world of carpentry building houses, furniture, whatever. Fortunately for the country music community Greg found out he could sing, and pretty well. In this CyberCountry Minute from the Texaco Country Showdown Greg tells Lance Yelvington how it feels to be doing what he loves to do and also making it to the Ryman Auditorium.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this CyberCountry Minute from the Texaco Country Showdown California native & finalist Greg Scudder tells Lance Yelvington how it feels to be doing what he loves to do onstage at the Ryman Auditorium.

item.title: New Music & Tradition: Texaco Country Showdown 2011
item.description: The Country Showdown has a new sponsor, Texaco. While this is great news for the Showdown the one thing that hasn't changed is the enormous strength of the variety of great musicians competing for this coveted prize. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington is in the Ryman Auditorium introducing us to the future of country music showing it couldn't be in better, more talented, hands.

item.title: Alex Maddox: At The End Of The Day
item.description: The tiny details of human emotion are part of every day life, and a part we usually don't really make a point to notice. Independent artist and songwriter Alexandra Maddox does notice these subtle intricacies. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington introduces us to Alex as she shares with us what her experiences have shown her at the end of the day...

item.title: Ashley Gearing: Tell Me What You Think About Us
item.description: Any artist who gives you a dynamic, exciting presence on stage immediately connects with the audience. Lance Yelvington in this CyberCountry Minute introduces you to Curb Records' Ashley Gearing. And as you'll find out, she puts the honest excitement of pure talent into another category entirely (and that's definitely a good thing).

item.title: DJ Miller-Fun For The Fans & More!
item.description: There are entertainers you can tell from the minute they hit the stage they're not really there. The only reason they even take to the stage is to sell the next CD, get some promotion or make their next gazillion dollars. This probably won't happen to DJ Miller though. In fact, DJ believes and artist's ability to connect with the crowd almost immediately upon taking the stage then keeping that attention is the single most important thing the entertainer should do. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington shows us DJ truly takes this belief to heart.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: There are entertainers you can tell from the minute they hit the stage they're not really there. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington introduces us to DJ Miller, an artist who takes his fun and music seriously.

item.title: Debbie Nunn: London's Summer Sun
item.description: Debbie Nunn is an artist with an beautiful, soft, unmistakeable voice that touches precisely the right place in the hearts of her listeners. She first talked to CyberCountry back in 2006. Since then her career hasn't slowed down, either! Debbie took the time from her busy schedule to talk to Lance Yelvington about her music, country, the English rain and her latest music and videos in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Amber Hayes: C'mon!!!
item.description: Amber Hayes was born an entertainer. She was singing, performing, even hosting her own 30-minute Country music show, "Amber & Friends" at state fairs, private parties and corporate events by the time she was eight. With the current trajectory her career is taking there are definitely more great things ahead for Amber. Lance Yelvington introduces us to this musical dynamo in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Chelsea Field: Dance With Me
item.description: She is a stage presence you just cannot mistake for someone who is just there to take up time. Chelsea Field has worked hard to come to the success she's now seeing in Nashville. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington introduces you to Chelsea Field, a rising star that will grab your attention and hold on tight!

item.title: Twangtown Paramours: The Originality Of Heartfelt Sound
item.description: Mike T. Lewis and MaryBeth Zamer are paramours in the truest sense of the word. What's more, they do indeed live in the Twangtown that is Nashville. Their unique blend of perfect melody, though, is what really captures the attention of anyone who hears them perform. Lance Yelvington introduces us to the uniquely melodic sound that is the Twangtown Paramours in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Jeff Orr-Keeping It Simple...
item.description: Meet Jeff Orr. Anyone who meets Jeff and gets the chance to hear him sing gets the genuine article when it comes to purebred country music. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance Yelvington talks to Jeff about life, music and keeping it simple.

item.title: Derek Hoke-Goodbye Rock 'N Roll
item.description: These days it's tough to tell where the line is drawn between rock 'n roll and country. One person who is continually crossing that line with a lot of success is Derek Hoke. With Derek's help and music Lance bids farewell to Rock 'N Roll and gives us a truly unique take on some great sound in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Deep Step-Living The Country Life & Loving Every Second
item.description: It's tough to describe to someone who isn't surrounded by it how great it is to live the country lifestyle. Dave and Scott Brantley of the group Deep Step are living proof of the benefits of this. In this CyberCountry Minute Lance introduces us to a group that shows you why it's a great thing to stay close to country's roots.

item.title: The Key To Improvisation Or How To Deal With A Broken G-String!
item.description: Nothing ever goes as planned, ever. Most of us who have worked in entertainment for years understand that. How people deal with this certainty will pretty much determine their success in the business. Lance Yelvington shows us how Jeremy Parsons with the help of Best New Nashville host Bernard Porter turn this temporary problem into big laughs.

item.title: Jaclyn North-The Beauty Of Work & Music
item.description: Jaclyn North is one of those people you know will shoot straight with you. You know this ability is based on the hard work and experience that's taken her from Texas to the American Idol auditions to right here in Nashville. In this CyberCountry Minute Jaclyn tells Lance Yelvington about the beauty of music, what's in her future and how she feels about Twitter.

item.title: Lauren Taylor-Turning Heartache Into Music
item.description: Birmingham native Lauren Taylor knows a thing or two about heartache even though she's in high school. While some of her classmates might take that pain and internalize it, Lauren turns those feelings into song. She tells Lance Yelvington more about her music and motivation in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Sarah Wilson-Walkin' On The Blue Side
item.description: Chicora, Pennsylvania isn't the first place you think of when you think about country singers. But thanks to the Colgate Country Showdown and a ton of other appearances at various country venues that will change. Sarah Wilson calls Nashville home now. Her beginnings, though, are rooted in the culture of this tiny town near Hershey, Pennsylvania. Getting to Nashville wasn't a matter of just deciding to head out the door one day with a guitar on her back. Sarah has paid her dues, for sure. Let's find out more about Sarah in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Todd Fritsch: Corralling Success In Country
item.description: These days people really don’t take the time to appreciate where they’ve been. In the high speed world of modern times we blow right by everything we used to hold dear. Todd Fritsch isn’t one of those people. Being a working rancher as well as a fairly talented singer keep him grounded to the Texas roots from which he sprang 25 years ago. Find out why you'll be hearing more from this cowboy in the near future in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: Mule Day 2007-100 Years Of Tradition And Strength
item.description: Though we don't acknowledge it daily (and not that we shouldn't) humankind owes a lot to the beasts of burden that help us. Columbia, Tennessee celebrates the tradition of the humble yet strong mule in it's Mule Day Celebration. This year marks the Centennial of Mule Day. We find out more about Mule Day, its country roots, its future and its growing fan club in this CyberCountry Minute.

Much of this comes from his wide ranging musical experiences he's had up to now. With the release of the album, "Peace, Love and Coondawgs", Cody shows just how expansive his tales of hard living as well as those of the traditional relate to the average listener today. We find out more in this CyberCountry Minute.

Also, how many country artists can you say fly helicopters for the U.S. Army? Let’s find out more about this country music high flyer in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: DeLana Stevens: Welcome To Her World And Her Blossoming Career

Such is the case of DeLana Stevens who calls the great outdoors of Basin, Wyoming home. Basin might not be the kind of place you’d find the next country music star. Given time, though, that might change if DeLana has anything to say about it.

item.title: Song Of The Year Gets The Red Carpet Treatment
item.description: Every single member of the country music community knows that each part of their culture is built on the music carefully crafted by songwriters. The best songs are awarded special status each year by the Country Music Association during the CMA Awards. The Cracker Barrel Country Store has collected some of the best artists country has to offer to sing the winners of the CMA's "Songs of the Year" category on a new CD. To celebrate the release of this compilation country music's finest came to the Schermerhorn Symphony Center to give homage to the best songs of the past. Lance Yelvington tells us more.

item.title: Lucie Diamond: Nashville's Country Breeze From Britain
item.description: Lucie Diamond's voice is pure country though her background isn't exactly what you think of when you think of the Grand Ole Opry. Her voice, though, does ring with the influence of country icons like Dolly Parton as well as other pop music influences. She's already won awards from the European Country Music Association for Female Vocalist of the Year & European Country Artist of the Year. From what Lucie says, too, the best is yet to come for her. In this story Lucie tells us what she likes about performing and the fans for whom she sings.

item.title: Zane WIlliams: Handcrafted Musical Treasure

He tells us more in this CyberCountry Minute.

item.title: The Third Edition of the Americana Folk Festival
item.description: They came. They saw. They laid around in the grass with their families and listened to some really fantastic Americana music! The gracious citizens of Burns, Tennessee played host to the Third Annual Americana Folk Festival at Montgomery Bell State Park October 21. Fans from all over made good use of the phenomenal fall weather to see musicians like Patty Griffin, Chely Wright, Ballhog!, Zane Williams, Little Country Giants as well as many, many more. Lance Yelvington takes us into this musical outdoor party.

item.itunes:summary: She's like a lot of the people coming to Nashville in pursuit of that dream of country music stardom. That's a long road to take as anyone in the industry will tell you. But she's making it happen one insightful original song at a time. She tells us more about making it in Music City in this edition of the Music City Minute. Check out her website at: http://www.vanpreston.com/

item.title: Rockabilly: The Basics
item.description: It was first thought to be the what rock n' roll should be. But as more commercial concerns moved in the country soul of rock n' roll became known as 'Rockabilly'. Find out more what some folks think of rockabilly and Jerry Lee Lewis.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington

item.title: Kyle Wyley: Rising Talent Is The Real Deal
item.description: His voice communicates the true essence of that which is seen as country music. Kyle Wyley is the genuine article when it comes to his music and more. Find out why people are calling this star on the rise the 'Real Deal'.
item.itunes:author: Lance Yelvington

item.title: CMA Festival 2006
item.description: They came, they saw, they twanged. Nashville recovers from another Fan Fair endorphin rush. But there was much more to CMA Music Festival 2006 than met the eyes or ears. Lance Yelvington takes us through what and who the average and not so average country music fan saw in Music City.

item.title: Brian McComas: Country Music's 3D Experience
item.description: Brian McComas is as country as they come. But he is far from your typical country newcomer. Brian thinks music should be something that’s not just a passing attraction for the listener. It should be a consuming experience that takes the audience from all sides. Brian tells us more in this Music City Minute.

item.title: Rustie Blue: 'Chippin'' Away At Country Stardom
item.description: Rustie Blue is a bundle of energy whether she’s onstage or she’s coming through on our vodcast. The greatest thing about Rustie is her honesty shown through her lovely voice and her insightful songwriting. Find out more about Rustie through our Video Podcast.

item.title: Paulette Carlson: Down The Road With Highway 101 To Now
item.description: The road to success hasn't been as easy as it looks for Paulette Carlson. But the trip down this road has given her some great things. She showed us a lot as the lead voice for country group Highway 101. She tells us more in this exclusive interview at the Country Music Hall of Fame.

item.description: This is an introduction to the CyberCountry Video Podcast. We'll be showing you Music City and country interests all over the world. Sit back, hang on and enjoy our ride around Nashville and beyond!
